page.title: 11GAMES WE PLAY:-1
page.content: CONKERS. Two people stand about half a metre apart and one person holds out their conker (a horse chestnut) on the end of a piece of string.The other person takes a shot with their conker and tries to split his opponent's conker.If you succeed then your's is a 'oner'.If you split a conker which is a 'fiver' then yours would be a 'sixer'.Some people use 'laggies' which are more than a year old.They are rock hard and last much longer. MARBLES. When you play marbles you start by tapping your opponent's marble to show that it is 'keeps'. Then you roll the marbles about five metres apart.The object of the game is to try to hit your opponent's marble. If you do then you keep it.We invent extra rules as we play.
